You should really put a aposterphy after the "n" in Assassins. Searching for this was a pain because you didn't spell it exactly as the game has it.

Also, this didn't work for me. In order for me to get the voices to work, I had to change my audio cards channels. Hopefully some of you can do this. Full sound only works when you use either 2 or 4 channels. I usually use 8, but in this case, it didn't work.

Wonder if anyone can confirm this with a legit copy.

*** READ THIS ***

For those of you who can't get voices to work, change the channels used in your audio card from 8 or 6 to 4 or 2. For some reason full sound doesn't work with more than 4 channels. That means you might have to change your audio to Stereo or Quadraphonic under Control Panel Sound configuration.

this works and for those who have trouble plz see-

* If using Realtek High Definition Audio, Soundmax HD Audio, or nForce Audio, you
may experience sound anomalies. To work around the problem, reduce the Hardware
acceleration slider to 'Basic' in the Windows Control Panel -> Sounds and Audio
Devices -> Audio tab -> Advanced -> Performance tab.

PS : and if your in the game while you change this settings, you have to restart the game before the problem is fixed (before you whine and ***** on these comment pages)
